name: Ingrid Hastings
rationale: The searchable farmers market directory -- complete with an interactive map -- lets users dig up information on local food sources by filtering through more than 8,400 farmers markets by zip code, city, state or market name. Users can review markets and view other user's ratings.
tech_used: Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, HTML & CSS, APIs
bio: Rails Developer with six years experience as a database and web programmer at Microsoft and Dell. I have a B.A. in Russian Studies from UT Austin. I'm not just kind of a coffee drinker.

name: Amanda Lemmons
rationale: A pet-friendly app that lets users search and save differently pet-friendly restaurants, hotels, parks etc. The app uses Yelps API and also includes an interactive map.
tech_used: Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, HTML & CSS, APIs

name: Konstantine Vogiantzis
rationale:
A fast, and aesthetically pleasing way to shop for records online.
Compare prices, and get info for each record.
Other Sites might have a larger catalogue, or be marketed towards collectors. This will be aimed more towards people first getting into record collecting, or enthusiasts.

name: Toni Lousteau
rationale: Daily Itinerary is an application that reminds users of calendar appointments at least two hours before their appointment, informs them of when they should leave their current location to arrive at their appointment on time, and calculates driving directions and commute times from their current geolocation to their event location.
bio: Prior to joining The Iron Yard in May, Toni graduated with a Master of Science Degree in biological engineering from Louisiana State University and worked as a field engineer in the oil and gas industry.

name: Ariston Claussen
rationale: arbitrader.info is a market information site dedicated to comparing asset prices across multiple exchanges
bio: I'm a serial tinkerer, entrepreneur, and computer geek who has learned that the more you learn, the more you realize how little you actually know. I was raised in the oil manufacturing business here in Houston and have many hobbies which fortunately coincide with my line of work. When I'm not making stuff or breaking stuff, I'm skateboarding, making loud music, or just enjoying time with my son.

name: Benjamin Howard
rationale: PetSet is an location based app that allows users to post and read posts relating to pet services and events. For example a dog walker in the area can post about their business, while people in the area can read and contact them about walking their dog.
tech_used: Backbonejs, Reactjs, Google Places API, Google Maps API
bio: I am a graphic designer from Houston Texas. I decided to take the next step in my career by attending The Iron Yard to expand my skills to include front-end development and digital design.

name: Bryan Dimas
rationale: The traditional school system makes learning boring and ineffective, but learning doesn't have to be that way. Peibel is an online community that makes learning more enjoyable and more meaningful. Whether you want to learn, or you want to teach, Peibel makes Project Based Learning a collaborative effort with people in your city.
tech_used: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Javascript, HTML & CSS, Git & Github, Heroku, 3rd Party APIs
bio: I started out programming hardware on the Arduino platform for a startup called RaptorBird Robotics. At the same time, I spent all my time coding websites with HTML and CSS. When I started adding functionality with PHP, I fell in love with programming web applications. So three years later I joined The Iron Yard academy and now I make Ruby on Rails applications with CSS and Javascript features.

name: Dana Nagle
rationale: A fashion industry app utilizing a digital comp card allowing agents at agent review to electronically record their impressions of new talent.
tech_used: Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, HTML & CSS
bio: Licensed, practicing attorney in the State of Texas.  Professional instructor, mediator and project manager.

name: Keyanna Mayfield
rationale: On demand app where you can get your favorite bottle of wine delivered in 1 hour or less.
tech_used: Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS, Javascript
bio: Lifelong learner. Tech junkie looking for the next big challenge.

name: Michael Z Cheng
rationale: With the act of Tasting at the center of it, Parting Glass explores the educational possibilities of a single glass of wine. Parting Glass endeavors to provide an natural prosthetic web app for wine professionals and enthusiasts seeking deeper wine knowledge. Take timed tastings. Study computer generated flash cards, or make your own. Review historic vintages and climate data.
tech_used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, Jquery, JSX, React, Backbone, Parse, Google Places, Forecast.io
bio: Michael Cheng is a recent graduate from Rice University. Holding a Bachelor's of English Literature, Michael is fascinated by all things aesthetic. After a Python course in his final semester, Michael was convinced that the nature of his textual study would have to take a radical turn towards the digital. Ever a reader an writer of poetry, prose, -and now, code.

name: Paul Saad
rationale: AdMi is a native app that creates a clean and effective method for sharing customizable contact information with those near you. It addresses the inconvenience of collecting, organizing, and inputting information from business cards into your phone, allowing you to concentrate on your real goals while networking. AdMi's versatility allows for its usage in many different settings: conventions, meetups, and one on one interactions.
tech_used: React-Native, Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Heroku, Postgresql, aws, geokit
bio: I am headed into my junior year at Rice University as a mechanical engineer.  Raised in Dubai,  I learned to never restrict myself to what the norm is around me, and run with my ideas.  I also learned how to recognize a good opportunity.  This program definitely was one of those - it has given me skills to develop my ideas and has introduced me to a great community.  I enjoy a good round of golf.

name: Martin Bee
rationale: AdMi is a native app that creates a clean and effective method for sharing customizable contact information with those near you. It addresses the inconvenience of collecting, organizing, and inputting information from business cards into your phone, allowing you to concentrate on your real goals while networking. AdMi's versatility allows for its usage in many different settings: conventions, meetups, and one on one interactions.
tech_used: React-Native, Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Heroku, Postgresql, aws, geokit
bio: I am a Rails Developer with an obsession for new ideas. My goal is to learn as much as possible about programming and to use that knowledge to bring ideas to life.

name: Joey F. Poon
rationale: AdMi is a native app that creates a clean and effective method for sharing customizable contact information with those near you. It addresses the inconvenience of collecting, organizing, and inputting information from business cards into your phone, allowing you to concentrate on your real goals while networking. AdMi's versatility allows for its usage in many different settings: conventions, meetups, and one on one interactions.
tech_used: React-Native, Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Heroku, Postgresql, aws, geokit
bio: I am a full stack software engineer, a learning enthusiast, and a programming addict. I am currently a student of the Rails engineering program at The Iron Yard Academy. I believe that technology exists to make life easier and I subscribe to the Rails Wayâ„¢. My favorite text editor is Atom and my prefered front-end stack is React + Backbone but I love learning new techs.

name: Hannah Sumner
rationale: 123kids is a online resource for parents in Houston to be able to compare schools, discover fun family places, find events and well as create custom events.
bio: Over 7 years experience in online marketing management in both domestic and foreign markets. Specializing in  search engine optimization, pay per click marketing, social media marketing and online product development.
